intro: Amomum surculosum, commonly known as wild cardamom, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, finger-like rhizomes. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers and has broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their strong, sweet aroma. Amomum surculosum thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its medicinal and culinary value.
